values:
got up at 5:30am, said goodbye to siska, then Paul took me to the airport, then said farewell to him too - paul and siska have been great too, really made sure I enjoyed myself!

Got my two flights, Perth -> Melbourne, and Melbourne -> Sydney with no problems, then got shuttle bus to my hostel - Wakeup! - its a great hostel, then I got a Hungry Jacks for dinner, then called home before heading to bed.
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/8642.html

Today my uncle had arranged for me to talk to a I.T. guy from Unisys about what sort of qualifications I would need to get a I.T. job out here - if come back on a working holiday visa.  My uncle is a builder and in charge of building the Perth Convention Centre at the moment, I had to get into a building site basically and I wasn't wearing proper shoes - so I really shouldn't be on a building site, but with him being the boss, I got in ok! Spoke to the I.T guy there, gave me some good advice.

Back at uncle's later on I said my goodbyes as I was leaving early in the morning for my flights to Sydney. It was great to see them and they made me so welcome.

In the evening back at Paul and Siska's we went for an evening beach walk - it was great, I wasn't expecting much before getting there, but it was great!  Good way to end my time in Perth.
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/8207.html

Today I headed to my uncle's house, he doesn't have his own swimming pool, but because his house backs onto the hotel golf course, they are allowed to use all the facilities there! so off we went, out the back gate, walking across the golf course, watching out for golf balls flying through the air, and then we made it to the resort pool, it wasn't too busy, so it was good, had a nice swim! Kept me cool too!

In the evening we had another BBQ at my uncle's before heading back to Paul and Siska's.
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/7949.html
Today I did nothing! I needed a day just to chill and relax. Nice.
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/7753.html

we went to Fremantle which is about 45 mins drive from Perth.  After visiting the local market, we had lunch - Fish and Chips! I had Shark!! It was really nice actually! Afterwards we paid a visit to the maritime museum, then to Fremantle prison.  I really enjoyed Fremantle Prison, better than Robben Island prison tour in S.Africa, The tour was too rushed at Robben Island, here you weren't rushed and it was so much more informative. 

On the way back to Paul's house we stopped off at Kings Park in Perth.  I really enjoyed it here, the view of the Perth skyline from here is amazing!

In the evening I went out on Paul's birthday night out!  Paul and Siska's friends were there too - they were all really nice.  We went to an area of Perth called Subiaco, it was a really good night!
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/7553.html

Today Paul was off work and we went to Rottnest Island...

Its a 45 minute ferry ride there, and after breakfast on the island we hired bikes and went to Henrietta Rocks, this area of the island has a few shipwrecks there and when Tony was here last year he loved the place!  Paul tried to call him on his mobile from here to make him jealous, but knowing it was about 3am back home I knew he wouldn't answer!  Afterwards we went to the other side of the island, to a place known as 'The Basin' - which is basically a natural swimming pool! Here I atempted snorkelling for the first time, and..... I REALLY enjoyed it! It was so good! Got some great views of fish, especially one that went past my face - about 2cm away!  Then a couple of hours later we headed back to Perth on the Ferry.  The island is really nice, and we picked a great day to go as it was 40 degrees and perfect conditions! (The day after was overcast).
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/7293.html

Obviously my relatives live in the Perth Suburbs, so today was my first chance to see central Sydney, when my aunt drove me in, its a really nice place, so much better than Liverpool, its so clean here!  While there I bought an OZ rough Guide book then met up with Paul on his lunch break, we went to the pub across from where he works and had a meal.  It was so hot today, and tomorrow is meant to be hotter!

In the evening all of us went to a Thai restaurant, which was really good, we had a great time, and they made a huge fuss to make sure I was having a good time!  Then  after the meal, Aunt and Uncle went home, and me, paul and siska went to paul's local pub for a couple of drinks!
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/7026.html

Today, Siska had the day off work, so we went shopping, as I needed shorts! Afterwards, we visited her Mum who is really cool!  Then all of us went to Hilary's  - harbour/shopping complex and we had lunch. Really nice place actually! Back at Paul and Siska's we had dinner, then played pool with Paul, beating him yet again....
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/6671.html

On the Monday, I went and saw my Aunt and Uncle at their house, was good seeing them again! Then we went to Scarboro Beach for a few hours, take a look around and stuff! Nice place, in the evening we had a BBQ back at my Uncle's then back to Paul's to watch a DVD.
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/6419.html

I got off the plane, and there was my cousin Paul straight away! He came to pick me up with his new wife, Siska (who I hadn't met before).  It was great to see them! They have lots planned while I'm here and seem really pleased I am visiting! Got to their house (live in Perth suburbs) and the house is amazing! Anyway, Paul put on the barbie and we had some dinner! Then we played a bit of pool in the games room. Then bedtime!
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/6295.html

Below is the story of my mammoth journey from P.E, S.Africa to Perth, OZ.

Got up at 5am to prepare for flight, shared a taxi with two girls from the hostel who were also catching the same flight to Jo'burg.

Only took 5 mins to get to the airport! so we were waiting a while in the airport after checking in!

First flight was about 1 hour 30 mins, it was ok, then got to Jo'burg, it was a bit of a trek to change from domestic to international terminals, and then when I got there I sat around for 7 hours 'airside' waiting for my next flight....

Time comes and I board the flight, also boarding are the South African Cricket team! Then the weather changes and thunderstorms keep us on the tarmac for 2 hours, it was still quite bad when we finally took off, but it must have been safe with the cricket team on board too! Then during this 12 hour flight I was wondering whether I would catch my connecting third flight to Perth, it was going to be a very close thing.

Got to Sydney and had to clear Immigration then pick up my luggage and go to the domestic terminal! It was still a very close run thing, It was leaving from Gate 8 - right at the end of the terminal, so I ran and got there about 3 mins before the gate closed, phew! Got on the plane and the hard work was done, I was so tired at this point but still couldn't sleep.  5 hours later and the plane lands, I am so excited at this point as I have finally ended my mammoth journey and finally in Australia (main bit of my trip) and I had relatives waiting for me!

In total, I was up for 42 hours.
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/6103.html

Well today was safari day, I had to do a safari while in S.Africa, today was it, not as good as say KrugerNP would be, but still I had a great day, Bradley our guide was superb, you could tell he was so passionate about his job and educating us about the park, we even passed thru the city and the townships on the way and he kind of gave us commentary on that too!!

Mostly saw Elephants at the park, got within 2 metres of some, it was amazing, took some great photos too! Saw antelopes, warthogs, ostrichs, and right at the end saw a rhino - only the second time bradley our guide has seen a rhino there in 3 years of doing the tour! I was very lucky!

Great day and great way to end my trip in South Africa, off to OZ tomorrow - well start my journey!
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/5835.html

I wasn't going to stay here in P.E long as didn't hear good things about it, but I'm staying in a very nice area here and near the beach, I'm actually impressed. Lucy, Lorna and me walked down to the beach front and took a walk around the area this morning, then stopped for lunch before having to head back to the hostel, I had laundry to do, had to be done today because tomorrow I am off to Addo Elephant Park and Saturday I fly out to Oz, can't turn up to meet my relatives in manky clothes!

Went the casino tonight with the girls, its at a place called 'The Boardwalk' - very nice entertainment complex.  I lost R100 at the casino which isn't much, I had a good time anyway, the girls lost about the same amount too. It was fun, good atmosphere there. Said farewell to the girls as they were catching the Baz Bus early in the morning, so meeting them again somewhere in OZ.
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/5607.html

In Storms River Village, there is only so much you can do, and the things you can do costs money.  After spending a bit of money yesterday I didn't do much today while waiting for the Baz Bus, updated journal, read more of my book, listened to music.  It rained all afternoon so I was in the right place, in the hostel! At 7pm the Baz Bus picked us up and it was a long journey to my final destination in S.Africa - Port Elizabeth, arrived there at 10:30pm, even met Lucy and Lorna again on the bus, they are staying a couple of days in P.E so again some people I know! - This 'travelling alone' lark isn't bad at all. Staying at Lungile Lodge, very nice place actually and paying the least money a night I have paid so far, definitely worth it!
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/5231.html

Today after going to get food from the shop for breakfast, me and Gemma went to do the tree top canopy tour http://www.treetoptour.com , it was really good!!! We got kitted up - harness and helmet, did the safety thing then got driven into the forest and swung between trees high up! I volunteered to go first out of the 4 people in our group, and every zip wire run was great! I even had photos taken of me between the trees on the wire, can't wait to see them!  Then afterwards we had lunch with the other two people in the group and the two guides, was good actually!

Gemma left tonight on the Baz Bus, we said our farewells as she is off to Jefferys Bay for a few days and I probably won't see here again in S.Africa, so will be in OZ. Then after quite a costly day, it was time to bring out the 2 minute noodles for dinner, yum, yeah right. Watched 'Cast Away' for about the 6th time before going to bed.
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/5047.html

Couldn't sleep last night, Dean sleeping in the bunk above me was snoring so loud! Was supposed to go to Robberg Peninsula today for a hike but I did my knee in last night, and also the girls didn't want to go as its too hot, so didn't do much til the Baz Bus arrived at 6pm to take me to storms river and Tube & Axe B/P. Quite a few people got off here, Gemma did too so again someone I already knew, so did aussie Adam who I had met before too. Had to pay R40 for dinner at the hostel which is quite expensive but I had no choice as the only shop in the village shuts at 6pm and I had no food. After dinner we all sat outside around the fire looking at the stars - it was cool. Me and Gemma are planning to do a tree top canopy tour tomorrow, should be good :-)
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/4734.html

Today after managing to get a seat on the Baz Bus for tomorrow, I chatted to aussie Sophie over Breakfast then we headed down to the main street, not much to see there really, but didn't bother me really as overall plett is a nice place. Then spent afternoon relaxing on the dorm balcony listening to music.  In evening we popped down to Shoprite and bought our food for the Braai, and once the fire was well underway we started cooking, it took a long time to do, but well worth the wait, really enjoyed it - especially my steak! It was a good way to end the weekend in Plett Bay actually made a good few friends here, as well as Gemma already, there was now Lucy and Lorna - all of which I should bump into in OZ.
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/4484.html

This morning (Sat 31st) we all headed to the beach, was a really nice beach actually, I took a walk along the beach for a while, so relaxing. I didn't hang around the beach for long as didn't want to be out in midday sun getting fried!

Got back to hostel and watched the Man Utd v Southampton Game, then the big one... Liverpool v Everton! pity it ended as a draw, we should have won!

Evening again was sitting around the fire, with a few beers! Tomorrow, me, Dean, Gemma, Sophie, Lucy, and Lorna are all going to get to together and buy the food for a Braai (BBQ), should be good! Beers too of course....
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/4098.html

Today (Friday 30th) while waiting for the Baz Bus to pick me up, i didn't really do much to be honest, got on the baz bus, and bumped into Gemma (from CT) again! We were both going to same place and hostel, infact about 7 people got off at the same hostel, after me and Gemma sharing a pizza that tasted bloody awful, we all sat around the fire outside in the evening drinking several beers! Here for the weekend, should be good.
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/4076.html

Ok it was very sunny today, back to normal!

Looked around the town centre, its a very nice place actually, then chilled out a bit, then headed out for dinner with Tom and James, and a girl from the hostel that I knew, but her name escapes me - sorry! Anyway, meal came to just under 2 Pounds, and for what we got it was superb! After dinner, headed down to the waterfront lagoon area, really nice as the sun was setting. Considered doing an adventure type thing here in Kynsna, like mountain biking in the forest, but left it too late to book, and I'm sure I'll get chance to do it again somewhere else on my journey.

I leave here tomorrow (Fri 30th) on the Baz Bus, going to Plettenburg Bay for the weekend.
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/3727.html

While waiting for the Baz Bus, I read more of 'The Hobbit', read 110 pages so far - impressive for me as some of you might know I don't read books!  Got on Baz Bus at 2pm and arrived in Kynsna just after 4pm.  Shortly afterwards it began to rain - first rain on my trip! :-( It was snowing on the same day back home though! :-P

The Hostel isn't upto much, it has got good reviews - not sure why to be honest, it will do though. Sharing a very small 6 bed dorm with 2 brits, Tom and James, and two SA girls, all seem good people.  Tom and James had brought their guitars with them travelling, so got them out and played a few songs - it was really good.
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/3463.html

Tuesday and the Baz Bus arrives, 5 new people!!! Thank you god!!! People to talk to (I forgot to mention the other guy in the hostel is a wierdo), so today was a bit better! Germans, an australian, and a Belgian. Even popped down the beach, even though, it wasn't much! Probably only good thing about Mossel Bay was the free pool table in the hostel! I leave on the Baz Bus tomorrow (Wed 28th), can't wait!
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/3143.html

Left early on the Baz Bus this morning- about 8am (26th Jan), on way to a small town called Mossel Bay. Got there at 2pm.  Got at hostel and there was only me and another guy staying there, it was dead! I didn't like it already! Anyway I headed out and noticed there wasn't much to see either, so even worse!  I was originally booked for three nights but quickly decided to change that to 2 nights, and I also changed my Baz Bus booking.  On Monday with the place being dead and not much going on out in the town centre, I sat and read some of 'The Hobbit', then early night! Yawn!
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/2999.html
After doing everything I wanted to do in Cape Town, Sunday (25th) was spent by... not doing much, chilling out really! Baz Bus leaves first thing Monday morning, so early night.
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/2606.html

I went up Table Mountain on saturday with a couple of people from the hostel, I was worried I wouldn't get up there before I left as the last couple of days, it has either been too windy for the cable car, or the cloud cover reduced visibility.  Anyway conditions were perfect on Saturday afternoon, so we went up there, cable car revolves, which is very strange, my ears 'popped' as well which was freaky.  We walked around the top of table mountain for about an hour and a half, it was superb, no actuallly, there is no word to describe how good the view is!!!  We ended up staying up there for about another hour having a beer and chatting, was wierd being above some of the cloud, definitely the highlight of my trip so far. :-D
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/2333.html

Friday (23rd), and my plan was to go up Table Mountain in the morning and Robben Island in the afternoon.

I went up to the cable station only to find it closed due to high winds!!! I wasn't going to walk up (I had considered it before arriving here, but when you see how big it is.... no chance!) so I decided to go straight to the Waterfront to try and see Robben Island.

Got there about 11:30am, booked my ticket for the ferry, it wasn't leaving til 2:30pm so I had a bit of a wait! The waterfront can keep you entertained for a while though, so it wasn't that bad.

2:30pm came and on the ferry, took about 30 mins to get there, then we were put on buses and driven around the island.  We stopped off at one place, which has the most superb view of Cape Town with Table Mountain in the background.  I am looking forward to getting those photos back!

Then we were taken to the Prison, here I didn't really think it was appropriate to take many photos here, I had a strange feeling inside me, I can't explain it.  Our guide around the prison was a former prisoner, so it was really interesting to hear what it was like from someone who had actually experienced it.  We got rushed through the section where nelson mandela's cell was, which was a bit of a disappointment, we just walked down the corridor really, couldn't stop due to time running out.

But I'm glad I went, was a 'good' day.

Got back to hostel and in the bar got chatting to a girl called Gemma who is in a similar situation as me, travelling alone, etc.  Was good to chat to someone in a very similar situation, at first we thought we were both on the same plane coming to Cape Town, but she made a mistake and she came on the flight a day later!  Anyway we had made plans to go upto Table Mountain, on Saturday.....
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/2282.html

Thursday was a bit of a waste day really, I had planned to go upto the waterfront and go to Robben Island, On the way up I stopped off on long street for a bite to eat and also to buy a wide rimmed hat.  Anyways I started then to make my way to the waterfront, only to start to get a really bad headache, I had realised I hadn't drank as much water that day as on previous days and I had now paid the price.  Because I was feeling quite bad I decided to head back to the hostel.  But even feeling ill I did manage to sort out the places I am going to stop on the garden route.  I am going to stop in Mossel Bay, Knysna, and Plettenburg Bay.  I have booked the hostels there already and I called up to book seats on the Baz Bus, had a bit of a problem at first with it, as apparantly buying the ticket back home makes it awkward to confirm I have actually paid for it!

Early Evening and I began to feel better, spent night in the bar, and had a BBQ. Talking to a few lads from the UK.
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/1930.html

On Wednesday (21st) I went on the Cape Peninsula tour, There were 8 of us on the tour, 6 from my hostel and we picked up two other people.  We travelled down the west coast of the peninsula first, stopping off at a few places on the way, then at lunchtime we arrived at the Cape Of Good Hope National Park.  Then the bus stopped so we could get out, unload the mountain bikes and we all went on a 10 Km bike ride.  It was really good doing the ride, because its better than being stuck in the bus all day! The last uphill part was a killer though! - and the tour guide said most of the run was downhill!! - yeah right!

Then we had a picnic lunch, got chatting to an english guy called Charles and an Aussie guy called Andrew about Football, found out they were both Liverpool Fans, so we had a good chat about that for a while!

Then we made our way back on the bus to Cape Point, Beware of the Baboons! If they see you eating food of drinking they will come and attack you!  When we were there a baboon swiped a bottle of coke from a girl in the car park and ran off!

We all walked up to Cape Point, well worth it as the view was amazing.  Then after walking back down we all decided to walk up to the cape of good hope, this was a harder walk as there was no defined path, so this was more tricky, one of the girls from the uk called Nikita was worried about being attacked by a baboon so she stuck with me on the way up. Then when walking down we all battled to get our photos taken next to the cape of good hope sign, as we got there though 2 bus loads of japanese tourists arrived, I thought I would have to move all my future flights forward a few months  as it looked like we would be waiting for a while, but we kind of pushed in the queue and louise our guide had 8 cameras around her neck trying to take our photos, while at the same time the japanese group are booing us because there are 8 photos to take! It was so funny!

On way back to Cape Town, we stopped off at Simon's Town to see the Penguins, They were cool, got some great photos, hope they turn out ok!

So end of trip and I had a great day, made a few friends, I might be going up Table Mountain tomorrow with a girl from Canada called Nicole who was on the tour, so at least I don't have to go on my own!

When I got back to hostel, I met the new person in the dorm, a german guy called Chris, seems like a bit of a hippy - asked if I wanted to play chess with him, he likes to play it with the ocean around him apparently, bit wierd, but he seems ok!

Went to the hostel bar in the evening, talking to the wierd german and got talking to a few others staying there. So was a good day!
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/1758.html

On Tuesday I went up to Long Street, I had heard quite a bit about it before coming here, full of 'characters' and also the backpacking hub of Cape Town. The atmosphere was great, and this was where the funniest moment has happened so far on my trip...

I was walking up the road and this guy stepped out to try and get my attention for money etc (You get this a lot here so wasn't really anything surprising), but to get my attention he called me "Hey White Man" which I thought was quite amusing!

Also went to Green Square Market where you really get to see a bit more culture of cape town and africa in general, with lots of wierd and wonderful things on sale!

In the evening when back at hostel I joined in the pool competition in the bar, didn't win, but I wasn't too bad!
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/1533.html

Hostel looks good, sharing (at the moment) with 3 lads from somewhere in scotland, and two girls from London, they seem like a good bunch of people so thats good. I was shattered when I got to the hostel but I didn't want to go to bed straight away so after settling in and getting a drink down me, I popped out for a bit of shopping and to get familar with the place. A quick kip early evening was needed, so after that I popped in the bar with a couple of people. Then back to bed! Had a great sleep, I'm now refreshed! LOL

Still trying to get used to the money though!!!!
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/1160.html

After leaving Manchester at 4pm Sunday 18th, and both flights being delayed (not by that much) I arrived in Cape Town on Monday 19th just before 10am.  Didn't get any sleep on the flight, but the likes of Red Dwarf and Father Ted kept me entertained on the flight.  The meals were surprisingly nice! I couldn't believe it! Chicken Korma for the dinner, and Bacon and egg sandwich for breakfast.  I still can't believe they were nice!  Got a free lift from the airport too, offered by the hostel, bonus!
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/893.html

Hello!

After being nagged and nagged about it, I will use this as my travel diary while I am away on my trip, No really.......I will!

More soon...

Terry
http://terrystravels.livejournal.com/692.html
